Extract Kinship

Source: vignettes/kinship.Rmd
kinship.Rmd

Run simulation:

library(dplyr)
library(tekkamaki)

result = tekka("--seed=42 -y100 -l3 --sa 10,10 --sj 10,10") %>% print()
#> # A tibble: 1 x 2
#>   sample_family                   demography                   
#>   <list>                          <list>                       
#> 1 <sample_family[,6] [7,485 × 6]> <spec_tbl_df[,5] [4,601 × 5]>
sample_family = result$sample_family[[1L]] %>% print()
#> # A tibble: 7,485 x 6
#>       id father_id mother_id birth_year location capture_year
#>    <int>     <int>     <int>      <int>    <int>        <int>
#>  1    74         0         0         -4       NA           NA
#>  2    75         0         0         -4       NA           NA
#>  3    73        74        75          1       NA           NA
#>  4    77         0         0         -4       NA           NA
#>  5    78         0         0         -4       NA           NA
#>  6    76        77        78          1       NA           NA
#>  7    72        73        76          8       NA           NA
#>  8    81         0         0         -4       NA           NA
#>  9    82         0         0         -4       NA           NA
#> 10    80        81        82          1       NA           NA
#> # … with 7,475 more rows

Extract kinship with degree≤4:

kinship = find_kinship(sample_family, 4L) %>% print()
#> # A tibble: 133 x 5
#>     from    to path   degree label
#>    <int> <int> <chr>   <int> <fct>
#>  1     1    33 110_1       3 HUN  
#>  2     1  7036 110_1       3 HUN  
#>  3     2    15 100_1       3 HUN  
#>  4     2  7017 100_1       3 HUN  
#>  5     4    53 100_1       3 HUN  
#>  6     4  7023 1000_1      4 HGUN 
#>  7     5    11 1000_1      4 HGUN 
#>  8     5  7000 10_1        2 HS   
#>  9     5  7038 1000_1      4 HGUN 
#> 10     6  7035 1100_1      4 HC   
#> # … with 123 more rows
kinship %>% dplyr::count(label, .drop = FALSE)
#> # A tibble: 11 x 2
#>    label     n
#>    <fct> <int>
#>  1 PO        9
#>  2 HS       26
#>  3 FS        0
#>  4 GG        4
#>  5 GGG       0
#>  6 HUN      50
#>  7 UN        0
#>  8 HC       15
#>  9 C         1
#> 10 HGUN     28
#> 11 GUN       0

Bind other information to kinship data.frame:

sampled = sample_family %>%
  dplyr::filter(!is.na(capture_year)) %>%
  dplyr::transmute(id, location, capture_year, age = capture_year - birth_year) %>%
  print()
#> # A tibble: 120 x 4
#>       id location capture_year   age
#>    <int>    <int>        <int> <int>
#>  1     1        0           98     5
#>  2     2        0           98     5
#>  3     3        0           98     5
#>  4     4        0           98     4
#>  5     5        0           98     4
#>  6     6        0           98     4
#>  7     7        0           98     4
#>  8     8        0           98     5
#>  9     9        0           98     4
#> 10    10        0           98     5
#> # … with 110 more rows

kinship %>%
  dplyr::left_join(sampled, by = c(from = "id")) %>%
  dplyr::left_join(sampled, by = c(to = "id"), suffix = c("_from", "_to"))
#> # A tibble: 133 x 11
#>     from    to path   degree label location_from capture_year_from age_from
#>    <int> <int> <chr>   <int> <fct>         <int>             <int>    <int>
#>  1     1    33 110_1       3 HUN               0                98        5
#>  2     1  7036 110_1       3 HUN               0                98        5
#>  3     2    15 100_1       3 HUN               0                98        5
#>  4     2  7017 100_1       3 HUN               0                98        5
#>  5     4    53 100_1       3 HUN               0                98        4
#>  6     4  7023 1000_1      4 HGUN              0                98        4
#>  7     5    11 1000_1      4 HGUN              0                98        4
#>  8     5  7000 10_1        2 HS                0                98        4
#>  9     5  7038 1000_1      4 HGUN              0                98        4
#> 10     6  7035 1100_1      4 HC                0                98        4
#> # … with 123 more rows, and 3 more variables: location_to <int>,
#> #   capture_year_to <int>, age_to <int>
